Students may reserve books using the hold feature on their home school Destiny Discover website.

CSD commends each of you for the hard work and perseverance that this milestone of graduating high school signifies. We know great things will come from each of you. We can’t wait to watch each of you go out and make the world a better place and to see how you participate in rebuilding and reimagining our world after the virus. Good luck with all of your endeavors, and please know you will always be Decatur Bulldogs!

Here is a reminder from CSD's District Lead Nurse, Shonda Moore, MBA, BSN, RN, to all our parents, teachers, and students. Please remember to take care of yourselves during this stressful time

During times of uncertainty and stress, it is crucial to practice good sleep hygiene to help to keep you healthy. It can be very difficult to keep your sleep schedule while working and learning from home. Try to go to bed around the same time at night and get at least 7-9 hours of sleep. It's okay to sleep in a little bit later, but don't over do it. Sleep, along with exercise and eating properly can all help to keep you healthy. Make these a regular part of your day.

From more information from CSD's team of nurses, visit our Nurse Notes page here: https://www.csdecatur.net/site/default.aspx?PageID=4253

Congratulations to Jacaria Hobbs, Samuel Woldegiorgis, and Asha Yussuf! These three Renfroe students were honored at this morning's REACH scholarships signing ceremony and reception at Renfroe Middle School. CSD is proud to honor all three of these outstanding REACH scholarship recipients!
These students signed contracts to become REACH Scholars. The REACH Georgia Scholarship is a public-private needs-based scholarship opportunity with the mission to provide Georgia's academically promising students with the academic, social and financial support needed to graduate from college. Funding for the scholarship is through state and local partnerships. Thank you to The Decatur Education Foundation for providing the local funding for the scholarships! For more about REACH scholarships and the REACH program, visit http://reachga.org/. Congratulations again to Jacaria, Sam and Asha!
